headline: AI Capex Clouds The Tech Horizon, Even As Meta And Tesla Shine
summary: On Thursday, Nasdaq fell 1.3% as the market digested mixed results from some Mag 7 reports. The primary weight came from Microsoft. AI spending anxiety rippled through the software sector.

headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

raw.headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News

headline: Is ServiceNow (NOW) Using AI And Buybacks To Redefine Its Long-Term Investment Story?
summary: In late January 2026, ServiceNow reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing higher revenue and earnings, expanded its AI partnerships and customer deployments, and increased its share repurchase authorization to US$9.50 billion. An intriguing angle is how ServiceNow’s deepening integration of Anthropic’s Claude models into its AI platform is reshaping both internal productivity and mission-critical customer workflows across industries like healthcare and financial services. Next, we’ll...

headline: ServiceNow Leans Into Real World AI Agents As Valuation Pressures Mount
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) has rolled out a set of AI driven initiatives, including sector specific projects with major clients such as Fiserv and Panasonic Avionics. The company has expanded its partnership with Anthropic to embed advanced AI directly into core ServiceNow workflows. ServiceNow has also updated its global Partner Program to support wider adoption of AI agents across its ecosystem. For investors watching the enterprise software space, these moves place ServiceNow in a central...
